risk_description: Mobile background location tracking (Travel Mode) is highly susceptible to OS-level battery optimization aggression, leading to terminated processes and gaps in technician tracking data.
root_cause: iOS and Android aggressively kill background processes consuming GPS to preserve battery; strict permission requirements for 'Always On' location.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a robust background-fetch library (e.g., react-native-background-geolocation) with motion-change detection to reduce polling frequency when stationary. Implement local SQLite queueing for coordinates when the network is unreachable.
contingency_plan: Fallback to 'significant location change' updates only (lower fidelity) or require the app to be in the foreground during active travel.
monitoring_trigger: Technician device heartbeat loss > 5 minutes while 'Travel Mode' is active.

risk_description: Complexity of Azure AD B2C Custom Policies (XML/IEF) requires niche expertise, creating a single-point-of-failure dependency and potential delays in Auth flows.
root_cause: Identity Experience Framework (IEF) uses complex XML configuration that is difficult to debug and distinct from standard OAuth implementation skills.
mitigation_strategy: Engage an Azure Identity specialist consultant for initial setup. Utilize the 'Azure AD B2C Starter Pack' repositories. Implement automated B2C policy deployment via CI/CD to prevent manual errors.
contingency_plan: Revert to standard User Flows (non-custom) which reduces UI customization capabilities but guarantees core functionality.
monitoring_trigger: Auth configuration tasks exceeding estimated effort by >20%.

risk_description: Data consistency issues between the transactional database (PostgreSQL) and the search/analytics engine (OpenSearch) due to eventual consistency latency in the event-driven architecture.
root_cause: Decoupled microservices architecture relying on Azure Service Bus for data synchronization introduces lag and potential message failure scenarios.
mitigation_strategy: Implement the Transactional Outbox Pattern to ensure events are never lost even if the broker is down. Implement idempotent consumers in the Search service.
contingency_plan: Implement a nightly full-reindex batch job to repair data drift between Postgres and OpenSearch.
monitoring_trigger: Lag between 'ProductCreated' event timestamp and OpenSearch document indexing > 10 seconds.

risk_description: Azure AI Document Intelligence (OCR) latency or failure rates for invoice processing may degrade user experience during product registration.
root_cause: Dependency on external API performance and the variability of user-uploaded image quality (blur, lighting, handwriting).
mitigation_strategy: Process OCR asynchronously: Return '202 Accepted' immediately to UI, process in background, and push notification/websocket update upon completion. Implement Client-side image pre-processing/compression.
contingency_plan: Provide a manual data entry fallback workflow if OCR fails or times out after 15 seconds.
monitoring_trigger: OCR API P95 latency exceeding 5 seconds or failure rate > 5%.

risk_description: AKS Networking complexity with Azure CNI and VNet integration may lead to IP address exhaustion or connectivity issues between pods and managed services.
root_cause: Azure CNI assigns an IP address from the VNet to every Pod, requiring rigorous subnet planning for scaling to 10,000 concurrent users.
mitigation_strategy: Utilize Azure CNI Overlay or Kubenet if IP conservation is critical, or pre-allocate a significantly large CIDR block (/16) for the AKS subnet. Use Terraform `cidrsubnet` functions for precise calculation.
contingency_plan: Re-provision cluster networking using Azure CNI Overlay networking mode to decouple Pod IPs from VNet IPs.

risk_description: Offline data synchronization conflicts in the mobile app may result in data loss or corruption when technicians work in low-connectivity areas.
root_cause: Technicians modifying job status or notes locally while the server state changes (e.g., dispatch reassignment) creates 'last write wins' conflicts.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a local queue (WatermelonDB/RxDB) with operation logs. Use a 'conflict resolution strategy' where server state is fetched before pushing local updates.
contingency_plan: Implement a manual 'Resolve Conflict' UI for technicians to choose which version of data to keep.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rate > 1% in mobile application logs.

risk_description: WebSocket Gateway scalability bottleneck under load (10k concurrent users) causing delays in real-time chat and location updates.
root_cause: Stateful WebSocket connections on AKS pods require sticky sessions or a Redis adapter for broadcasting across multiple pods.
mitigation_strategy: Configure the NestJS WebSocket Gateway with the Redis IoAdapter for horizontal scaling. Use Azure SignalR Service as a fully managed alternative to offload connection management.
contingency_plan: Migrate from self-hosted Socket.io on AKS to managed Azure Web PubSub or SignalR Service.
monitoring_trigger: WebSocket connection establishment latency > 500ms or drop rate > 0.5%.
